content:
the Penn State Interfraternity CouncilPanhellenic Dance Marathon is quickly creeping closer on the calendar and students are being told by University Health Services to watch out for a certain stomach virus PERIOD

UHS is urging members of the Penn State community to take necessary precautions to prevent the spread of a noroviruslike illness that may be circulating through campus according to a Penn State press release PERIOD

This virus is commonly referred to as a stomach bug and it leaves its host with nausea vomiting diarrhea stomach pain and sometimes fever or muscle aches according to the press release PERIOD

With THON nearing closer UHS wants students to be aware of this norovirus PERIOD The bug is highly contagious and easily spread from person to person through contaminated food and by touching surfaces contaminated with the virus according to the press release PERIOD

With no medication to cure the illness the infected have to suffer through its course if they contract the norovirus according to the press release PERIOD

Students are urged to take steps to stop the spread of the norovirus PERIOD As more and more cases are being seen by UHS refraining from sharing drinks food or frankly anything that has come in contact with someone elses saliva is advised according to the release PERIOD

Students should wash hands frequently after being in public spaces taking all precautions in attempt to evade this virus as they continue to prepare for THON weekend PERIOD
